worklogs.comment:
mrkn commented on pull request #3587: WIP: ARROW-4506: [Ruby] Add Arrow::RecordBatch#raw_records
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3587
 
 
   I want to add Arrow::RecordBatch#raw_records method to convert a record batch object to a nested array.
   
   This is the first step to implement the feature.  The following things are out of scope of this pull-request.
   
   - Half-float support
   - Unit treatment of Time32 and Time64
   - Conversion of the following compound data types to Ruby objects:
     - ListType
     - StructType
     - UnionType
     - DictionaryType
   
   ### TODO:
   
   - [ ] Extracting ListArray
   - [ ] Extracting StructArray
   - [ ] Extracting UnionArray
   - [ ] Extracting DictionaryArray
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

mrkn commented on issue #3587: WIP: ARROW-4506: [Ruby] Add Arrow::RecordBatch#raw_records
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3587#issuecomment-461694082
 
 
   @kou I have the following questions.
   
   1. Are there corresponding Ruby classes to Time32 and Time64?
   2. Do you have any ideas of how to treat units of Time32 and Time64 if the answer of the previous question is No?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on issue #3587: WIP: ARROW-4506: [Ruby] Add Arrow::RecordBatch#raw_records
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3587#issuecomment-461696825
 
 
   > Are there corresponding Ruby classes to Time32 and Time64?
   
   No.
   
   > Do you have any ideas of how to treat units of Time32 and Time64 if the answer of the previous question is No?
   
   We can find the unit of each column value by schema. So we can use raw `Integer` for both Time32 and Time64.
   
   Or we can create `Arrow::Time` for both Time32 and Time64. It has raw `Integer` value and unit.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fields.description: I want to add Arrow::RecordBatch#raw_records method to convert a record batch object to a nested array.
